data.enText: to separate sb/sth physically or socially from other people or things

data.chText: 这种病的患者应予以隔离。
data.enText: Patients with the disease should be isolated.

data.chText: 他被立刻与其他囚犯隔离开来。
data.enText: He was immediately isolated from the other prisoners.

data.chText: 这一决定会使国家从欧洲其他地方中孤立出来。
data.enText: This decision will isolate the country from the rest of Europe.

data.chText: 将…剔出（以便看清和单独处理）
data.enText: to separate a part of a situation, problem, idea, etc. so that you can see what it is and deal with it separately

data.chText: 可以找出造成她垮台的一些因素。
data.enText: It is possible to isolate a number of factors that contributed to her downfall.

data.chText: 使（某物质、细胞等）分离；使离析
data.enText: to separate a single substance, cell, etc. from others so that you can study it

data.chText: 研究人员仍然在试图分离导致这种畸形的基因。
data.enText: Researchers are still trying to isolate the gene that causes this abnormality.

simple_means.memory_skill: isol 岛 + ate 使… → 使成岛 → 孤立

means: 将…剔出(以便看清和单独处理)

ex.chText: 请将批阅完的考卷按及格和不及格分开。
ex.enText: Please separate the marked examination papers into passes and fails.

ex.chText: 这两个社区被一条狭窄的街道隔开。
ex.enText: The two communities are separated by a narrow street.

ex.chText: 她把4个鸡蛋的蛋清和蛋黄分开。
ex.enText: She separated the whites and yolks of 4 eggs.

synonyms.bx: 指将混合物按不同类别分开，也指把紧连在一起或溶合在一起的东西分开。

ex.chText: 这条河把我的果园和他的果园隔开了。
ex.enText: The river divides my orchard from his.

ex.chText: 这个苹果被分成了4等份。
ex.enText: This cake is divided into four equal parts.

ex.chText: 老师把全班分成5个小组。
ex.enText: The teacher divided the class into five groups.

synonyms.bx: 指把两个区域分隔开，或将一个整体分为若干部分，有时含平均划分之意。

ex.chText: 把道德责任和政治责任分隔开来是错误的。
ex.enText: It is wrong to isolate moral responsibility from political responsibility.

ex.chText: 这个村子因洪水而与外界隔绝。
ex.enText: The village was isolated by the flood.

ex.chText: 传染病患者应予以隔离。
ex.enText: People with contagious diseases should be isolated.

ex.chText: 执政党内的激进派坚持主张从政治上孤立该国。
ex.enText: The radical group in the ruling party insisted upon isolating the country politically.

synonyms.bx: 指区别看待问题、观点等，也指使人或物处于孤立、隔离的状态。

ex.enText: She parts her hair in the middle.
The crowd parted to let the police car through.
She hated being parted from the children.
She has parted from her husband.

synonyms.bx: 多指使紧密相连的人或物分开，指父母和子女分开时多用被动语态。

example: They isolated the political prisoners from the other inmates
The dentist sequesters the tooth he is working on
The chemist managed to isolate the compound

tr: separate (experiences) from the emotions relating to them

value.def: To isolate a person or organization means to cause them to lose their friends or supporters.

example.ex: This policy could isolate the country from the other permanent members of the United Nations Security Council...
example.tran: 这一政策可能会使该国孤立于联合国安全理事会其他常任理事国之外。

example.ex: Political influence is being used to shape public opinion and isolate critics.
example.tran: 政治影响正被用来左右公众舆论,使批评家们陷于孤立。

value.tran: 使孤立;使脱离(朋友、支持者)

example.ex: They are finding themselves increasingly isolated within the teaching profession.
example.tran: 他们发现自己在教育界越来越孤立无助。

example.ex: Diplomatic isolation could lead to economic disaster.
example.tran: 外交孤立可能导致经济灾难。

example.ex: ...the public isolation of the Prime Minister.

value.def: If you isolate yourself, or if something isolates you, you become physically or socially separated from other people.

example.ex: When he was thinking out a problem Tweed's habit was never to isolate himself in his room...
example.tran: 思考问题的时候,特威德从来没有把自己关在房间里的习惯。

example.ex: His radicalism and refusal to compromise isolated him...
example.tran: 他的激进主义与拒绝妥协使他受到孤立。

example.ex: Police officers had a siege mentality that isolated them from the people they served...
example.tran: 警察们有一种受围心态,这使得他们脱离了所服务的群众。

example.ex: But of course no one lives totally alone, isolated from the society around them.
example.tran: 但是,当然没人是完全脱离周围社会一个人生存。

value.def: If you isolate something such as an idea or a problem, you separate it from others that it is connected with, so that you can concentrate on it or consider it on its own.

example.ex: Our anxieties can also be controlled by isolating thoughts, feelings and memories...
example.tran: 我们也可以通过将一些想法、感情与记忆分开考虑以控制焦虑情绪。

example.ex: ...attempts to isolate a single factor as the cause of the decline of Britain...
example.tran: 试图分离出一种因素作为英国衰退的原因

example.ex: Gandhi said that those who isolate religion from politics don't understand the nature of either.
example.tran: 甘地说过,那些主张政教分离者对两者的本质都不了解。

value.def: To isolate a substance means to obtain it by separating it from other substances using scientific processes.

example.ex: We can use genetic engineering techniques to isolate the gene that is responsible...
example.tran: 我们可以使用基因工程技术把相关基因分离出来。

example.ex: Researchers have isolated a new protein from the seeds of poppies.
example.tran: 研究人员已经从罂粟种子里分离出一种新的蛋白质。
从脑组织里分离出的一种化学物质

value.def: To isolate a sick person or animal means to keep them apart from other people or animals, so that their illness does not spread.

example.ex: Patients will be isolated from other people for between three days and one month after treatment...
example.tran: 治疗结束后,病人将与其他人隔离3天到1个月的时间。

example.ex: You don't have to isolate them from the community.
example.tran: 你没必要把他们与社区隔离。

partsOfSpeech.dec: isol 岛 + able 可…的，能…的；具有…性质的 → 成岛的 → 可隔离的
isol 岛 + ate 使… → 使成岛 → 孤立
isolat 孤立 + ion 表名词 → 孤立；隔绝，隔离
isolation 孤立；隔绝，隔离 + ist …主义的 → 孤立主义者
